Posts.Content: Hi, would be great to keep in touch, does it sound awful to say its nice to speak with someone with very similar diagnosis ??(im sure you understand what I mean!!)...things tend to improve once im up and about and it has eased a little this morning.  Tbh I think some of the pain on my back is because I have to sleep on my back at the minute and its defo not my favourite position, im a lay on my front kind of girl!! I am doing my exercises but have not been using my arm as much, have been advised to use it for general day to day things as much as before? I think this may be right as I find myself holding it in a unnatural position which may contribute to the ache in my shoulder.  My work have been excellent and I am very lucky as I can work from home, I will see how things go as it does give me a bit of sanity back but dont want to interfere with healing. Do you know which chemo you will be having? I havent been told but by bcn said as I have node involvement and I am only 37 with no previous health issues I would most likely have (tac or tax??) Apparently strong stuff!!! Thankyou George and Jackie for responding, I have been reading on this site for a few weeks and have seen a number of replies from you, always helpful and knowledgeable,  I am worried about lymphoedema, any tips on how to reduce the risk ? Thank you xxx Louise
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi A, Hope everything went ok yesterday,  the joy of further waiting, feel like its all ive done since january. The good news for me was my drain did eventually get removed yesterday,  after getting stuck and needing yanking out, my nerves were less than pleased shall we say!! Feel much more comfortable today so going to get my exercises done and pop to the garden centre. Take care xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi, I have been checking out this site after recently being diagnosed with BC, early Jan. Laid here this morning in quite a bit of pain when I saw this post which has really interested me. I also had snlb and lumpectomy on 23rd January and I recovered quite quickly, back at work the second week. Unfortunately my results confirmed out of the 3 nodes removed one was cancerous the next had a micro met and the third was clear. I did however get a clear margin!! I then have had the clearance to remove all the remaining nodes and awaiting results. I am also in much stronger pain which goes from underarm all the way round to the top of my shoulder.  Its sort of a mixture of dull ache with stong nipping feelings that can be quite intense. I also still have my drain in as I am still leaking about 75ml a day. My bcn says this is all normal and will get better but ive really been knocked by this second surgery which was last Thursday.  I also feel quite low and emotional,  hope this improves as like you I will be starting chemo in about 3-4 weeks. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry just seen the lymphoedema link, thanks I will check it out xx
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, thanks for the advice, funnily enough that is the exact way I slept last night, on my opposite side with cushion between legs and one to lean my arm on. I am doing the exercises and have started to use my arm in everyday activities.  I am a bit disappointed with my drain as its still filling too much to have it removed this afternoon I think. I suppose it is better draining into a bottle rather than building up under the skin...I dont think I drain very well as I am still having lumpectomy wound packed every two days as I developed a huge haematoma a week after surgery in january and consultant literally cut it out and requested it is packed so I heal from inside to out. One thing I am slightly paranoid about is my shoulder blade has a dull ache sometimes but this can turn into a burning sensation,  tbh this is where most of my feelins have been.  I had it after my initial surgery in jan but it was fading but since I had the clearance last week the feelings have intensified.  I have spoke to my bcn and she just keeps saying its normal, has anyone else felt this ?? I very rarely get any pain in my breast which I find bizarre as thats where the pesky bleeder was!! Good luck with your scan this afternoon A, your hospital must operate different to mine, they will only scan if over 4 nodes are affected, from reading different posts I think it depends on  where you live, take care xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Pain and discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Thanks for the response,  it really helps to here from people who were diagnosed similar who are doing fine. I have spoken about scans etc but my bcn states that unless 4 or more nodes were affected or I was feeling pain anywhere for more than two weeks the hospital wont do them, I am receiving my treatment in Doncaster x
Posts.Title: Vascular Invasion.... anyone had it?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Bad day for me today,  went to see onc who advisec me I was to have Tac x6 chemo. When I asked why they had chosen this type she stated it was due to the fact one node was macro and one was micro, this I knew.. but then she said also there is the vascular invasion. I had already asked about this when my first pathology report was explained to me and told it wasn't present :(  She did go on to say they was no lymphatic invasion and I should remain positive as its chemos job to mop all these cells up. Can it really do this if they are already on the move. Is anyone on here that has had VI and come through ok? To top it off the lady who was in before me came out upset and advised me she has spread to her lungs :(, need some positivity please..... xx
Posts.Title: Vascular Invasion.... anyone had it?

Posts.Content: Thankyou for responding guys. I think the waiting for my chemo to start is having a massive effect on me as well. I have had to wait for a wound to heal before I can start which should be next week or the latest the week after. My initial surgery was the 23 january so its nearly 3 months. I lay here and imagine cells doing further damage which is stressing me. I know I need to be fully healed but its driving me insane... x
Posts.Title: Vascular Invasion.... anyone had it?

Posts.Content: Hi Could someone advise me what the true stance is on dairy and soya. When I was first diagnosed I stopped eating dairy and got soya food in. I then read that soya was worse...I am concerned if I dont eat either this will have an adverse effect on my bones as I will be going onto tamoxifen when my chemo finishes.  I have googled but get conflicting stories. I did ask my bcn and she advised everything in moderation. Has anyone actually been advised from they medical team regarding this?
Posts.Title: Er+ breast cancer, dairy or soya ???

Posts.Content: Hi I know my bcn advised me I would get strange feelings after op im a little confused about some of the feelings and was wondering if anyone else has felt similar.  Firstly my back of arm from top to elbow still feels bruised to touch, not really having anymore shooting pains, these stopped about 5 days ago. Underneath my arm pit when I move it feels like its on an elastic band, I have heard of cording but does that not affect down the arm? I can only explain mine as if you put your hand under your arm pit and felt your back a little it runs straight down to the scar line from the anc...Also I have no swelling but feel like a have something under my arm. I could understand if I had swelling but nothing!! Is my mind playing funny games or has anyone felt similar? Thanks Louise xx
Posts.Title: ANC strange feelings..

Posts.Content: Hi A, Just had the hair convo with bcn yesterday. I also thought about cutting my hair shorter before starting the cold cap but my bcn advised me its not necessary.  Actually she pointed out to me that if I find my hair difficult to control without styling it, which I do, I will be better leaving it so its long enough to put in a loose ponytail.  She said its more important to have hair wet with loads of conditioner and the cap to be as tight as possible.  If hair was going to fall she said it would fall whatever the length.  Also she advised me to be prepared to lose quite a bit in the first two cycles and check to see if im happy to continue. At a recent Look good, feel better session a lady was there with long hair and had minimal shedding. I think ultimately it works for some and not others and if you prepare for it to go as much as possible you will be fine, fingers crossed xxxx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Just bought the black polish today!! Good luck and let me know how you get on xxx
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi I have a 7/8 result and my bcn advised this is a positive as you can also be treated with hormone therapy for 5 to 10 years. Mine will be tamoxifen as I am pre menopause.  These can cause SE but have excellent results in woking towards stopping a reoccurrence.   Take Care xx
Posts.Title: Hormone positive receptors..

Posts.Content: Hi  I have read this thread and at first was mortified that you would not go down the conventional route, could not understand, if im honest parts of me still are...I worry that your next post may be negative and things may gave spread. I do however respect your decision,  I have too, it is your body and you believe in what you are doing. I couldn't do it, but to hear you are upset from previous posts does sadden me. I can see why you are but I know these ladies dont want to upset you, people naturally worry for anyone going through this whole process, we want everyone to succeed.  Please do not stop posting if it gives you support and help. I must agree with some of the facts though, ultrasound is not accurate,  I had one and there was no suggestion of spread everything looked fine, unfortunately 2 where infected. I am sure you realise this though and more.... everything is so complicated !!!! I wish you well, take care Louise x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi I have just started 6 cycles of TAC chemo,  I am day 19 at the minute. After my lumpectomy and node removal I had various pains across my back as I had a lot of nerve damage which resulted in a winged scapula...I had various teary phone calls with bcn who kept saying I was hypersensitive and the pain would subside...it has. Unfortunately for the last week I have a feeling that is not painful but more stitch like in the opposite side to surgery. Sometimes its on the side, sometimes on ribs under boob and sometimes just under at top of abdomen.  I can also feel it intermittently at the back of ribs. The feeling is not there all the time and never would affect my sleep but creeps up again every morning.. Has anyone felt this, I am googleing for hours trying to find an answer and just sit and cry sometimes thinking its spread all over that side.. I will mention it on thursday when I see my onc but he thinks I am a hypochondriac,  thing is I am one since this diagnosis.... Help please xxx
Posts.Title: need some advice....rib pain/niggles

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply. I went today and had examination and blood checks done and urine tested. Turns out I have a water infection and she said the pain is coming from my kidney ?? Never imagined this answer, she said I must not jump to the worst case scenario... easier said than done.  Anyway I have some antibiotics and chemo is still on for Friday xx
Posts.Title: need some advice....rib pain/niggles

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda Me too, I also venture onto the the bcc forum and both sites have been a help to me. I had a phobia of any surgery before my diagnosis and I have since had two surgeries in 2 months. Wont lie about it I cried buckets on the way to theatre the first time!! The second time I tried to concentrate on the feeling of satisfaction after the surgery... it worked, just a few tears that time! Good luck on your surgery next week, hope all goes well, take care, Louise xxx
Posts.Title: I am so glad I found this group

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Has anyone got any words of reassurance as I am getting slightly panicky about the length of time between treatments.  I found my lump on new years eve,  had my lumpectomy on the 23 jan and waited three weeks for the results. Unfortunately I had one node with a small amount of cancer and one with a micromet. I also developed a haematoma which opened my wound and has needed packing religiously until now when they have told me its just about healed, should be ok next week. I also had a further op on the 6th march to remove the other nodes, no further spread, they were all clear. My concern is I have been given the starting date for chemo as the 17th april. My onc and bcn keep reassuring me that weeks wont make any difference andits better im fully healed before the chemo starts.  Whilst I know they have no reason to lie to me I have been going into panic mode over the last few days desperate to start. Anybody else had to wait for chemo??? Louise xxxx
Posts.Title: diagnosis to chemo starting...worried

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Thanks for the replies everyone,  it does make me feel a bit easier about the situation. Spoke with my bcn and she actually said if I started chemo with a wound not fully healed, that could me life threatening! ! I will try and trust more, always been an impatient bugger xxx
Posts.Title: diagnosis to chemo starting...worried
